title: Actor. Writer. Whatever.
description: An honest, inspiring exploration of the New York acting world, ambition, and success, delivered by a fresh, bold insider’s voice. In her critically acclaimed essay collection, writer Mellini Kantayya exposes the pinnacles and pitfalls of pursuing artistic ambitions and life as a rank-and-file actor. Her unflinching depiction of show business, backstage anecdotes, and self-deprecating humor will resonate with both the creative and the curious—and inspire anyone who has ever juggled making art and making rent.
author: Mellini Kantayya
